quote: I actually was pretty frustrated with gravel because I didn't feel like I was strong enough to really race. I was always kind of a participant and finished in that middle-pack range. So, I took a step back from gravel and really focused on that higher-end power earlier this year...
I crashed in the single track and I bent my derailleur hanger, losing my easiest gears. [It] was fine for the most part because the course is pretty flat, except for the last climb at 110...

When I did get to that last climb of the day I had to walk. I tried to shift and it threw it into the spokes. I kept looking back, I was like, 'Where's Tiff? I know she's coming'. I made it to the top, never saw her, and the single track at the end really sealed the deal.

I was quickly realizing how evenly matched the two of us were on this day. Tiff and I traded pulls for the next 15 miles, the two of us adding and losing members of our group periodically. But unspoken, the two of us knew this race was between us.

BWR Utah is where my gravel journey began back in 2020 with a 9th-place finish. Since then I've added three more top-10s: 9th in 2022, 4th in 2023, 6th in 2024. And in 2025, it finally all came together as I achieved my long-term goal of winning this race.

Cedar City continues to welcome us with open arms, rolling out the red, yellow, and black carpet to host one of the most unique endurance weekends in the country.

The weekend kicks off with Friday's pre-race gathering—where riders, sponsors, and locals mingle over beer, banter, and pre-race nerves—and culminates in Saturday's full-throttle race and post-ride feast of waffles and Belgian ale.
Over 50 exhibitors will showcase the latest in bikes, gear, and performance tech. Local food trucks, craft beer, and live music will fuel the good vibes.
Equal prize money is awarded across three categories (M/W/Gender Diverse), with the top three (or, in some races, the top five) from each category receiving prize money.
These are not races set up for freeloading sprinters or frail climbers. They are designed to challenge riders of all stripes and sizes in demented and glorious ways.
